0.name: No Tumor
0.description: No brain tumor detected in the image.

1.name: Glioma
1.description: A type of tumor that occurs in the brain and spinal cord. Gliomas begin in the glial cells that surround and support nerve cells.

2.name: Meningioma
2.description: A tumor that arises from the meninges â€” the membranes that surround your brain and spinal cord. Most meningiomas are noncancerous.

3.name: Pituitary
3.description: A tumor that develops in the pituitary gland at the base of the brain. Most pituitary tumors are noncancerous (benign).
